title: Ebonyi moves to recover NLNG dividends from 1999 | Blueprint
text:
Ebonyi state government Wednesday said it would recover all the accrued dividends due to the state from Nigeria Liquefied Natural Gas from 1999 till date.
The state commissioner for Information and Orientation, Bar. Ikeuwa Omebe, disclosed this during press briefing on the outcome of Tuesday exco meeting.
Omebe further disclosed the approval of over N3 billion for construction of ultra modern clinic in the state government house.
Statement of the briefing read: “Following the retirement of most of the serving artistes in the State Council for Arts and Culture and in a bid to reinvigorate the State Cultural Troupe, Exco considered and approved the employment of 35 guest artistes. These artistes who will be talented, agile and vibrant young men and women are to fill the existing vacuum in the State Cultural Troupe to perform the expected entertainment roles of the Council. The approved artistes include; dancers, dramatists, choral singers and instrumentalists
“Ebonyi State as one of the sub-nationals in Nigeria is a shareholder in Nigeria Liquefied Natural Gas (NLNG), hence is entitled to the Federation’s NLNG dividend and other unremitted oil revenue. It is therefore imperative to review, reconcile and recover amount due to Ebonyi ftate from the federation’s NLNG dividend and unremitted oil revenue to the state from January 1999 to date.
“The technicalities involved needs a consultant who is conversant with the operations of oil and gas industry. The consultant was earlier engaged at 10% commission but has to be upwardly reviewed to 15% commission.
“Pursuant to the requested action for the needed expertise, Exco approved TIARAS White Consult Limited to undertake the review, reconciliation and recovery of amount due to Ebonyi State from the Federation’s NLNG dividend and unremitted oil revenue to the State from January 1999 to date and provided 15% commission of the total amount recovered as consultancy fee at source from Ebonyi State entitlement, accordingly.
“In line with the present administration’s commitment to accessible, world class healthcare for all residents of Ebonyi State, Exco considered and approved the sum of Three Billion, Five Hundred and Twelve Million, Four Hundred and Twenty-Eight Thousand, Seven Hundred and Sixty Five Naira, Thirty Three Kobo (N3,512,428,765.33) only for the construction of an Ultra-Modern Clinic within the Ebonyi State Government House premises.
“The facility which is envisioned as a state-of-the-art medical center, strategically positioned to serve as both an emergency response unit for government officials and a model health facility for the State, showcasing modern medical practices and technologies.
“Exco considered and approved the request for the acquisition of PENTECOST FOUNDATION HOSPITAL, EZZAMGBO by the State Government, with all the equipment and also to inherit the staff as at the time of taking over the facility at the cost of Two Hundred and Fifty Million Naira (N250,000,000) only.
“Pursuant to His Excellency’s practical vision to elevate the standard of sports infrastructure and youth development in the State, Exco considered and approved the proposed bill for the development of the Pool Service Building and Swimming Pool at the Ebonyi State Olympic Sports Center by PDoings Integrated Services Limited,, but further directed the ministry to properly study the proposal and revert back to Exco.
“In view of the need for further extension of potable water supply to Abakaliki metropolis, Exco approved the sum of Four Hundred and Twenty-One Million, Seven Hundred and Twenty Two Thousand, Three Hundred Naira (N432,822,300.00) only for the extension of already existing pipe network especially to the Ochudo Centenary city, Ebonyi State House of Assembly Complex through Odunukwe Street, Aguogboriga Layout and Mile 50-Ugwuachara Layouts.
“Following the indication of interest by a Chinese firm, Allallinfo Group AD to collaborate with the Ebonyi State Government to provide funding, equipment, Agro plants and global market for cotton production in the state, Exco approved a temporal allocation of part of EZZAMGBO Veterinary School for cotton farms and other Agro-industries in the state. This is also in line with the requirements by the Federal Government to recognise Ebonyi State as a cotton producing state and as well project the state to more Federal Government funding and interventions for sustenance.
“Drawing from the importance and the urgent need for the formulation and production of Abakaliki Capital Territory Structure Master Plan and an accompanying request for same, Exco considered and approved the engagement of a reputable Consultant to review and produce the final copy of Abakaliki Capital City Structure Master Plan for Ebonyi State, with special preference to an indigenous Consultant.
“The Report on the reevaluation of properties affected by the construction of multidimensional flyover at Vanco Junction, Abakaliki was presented by the Chairman of the Committee, Engr Ogbaonnaya Obasi and was received with great appreciation by the Exco.
“To ensure a face-lift of the 4,308m EBSU PRESCO Campus Internal and Peripheral Road, Exci approved the sum of One Billion, Three Hundred and Eighty-one Million, Seven Hundred and Nineteen Thousand , Two Hundred and Thirty-Eight Naira, Twenty-five kobo (N1,381,719,238.25) only to cushion the cost of the project.
“Also approved is the Bill of Engineering measurement and evaluation for the construction of 2.169km Hatchery Layout Road, Abakaliki to the tune of Six Hundred Million Naira (N600,000,000) only
“In exercise of their primary responsibility to monitor and evaluate the level of prudence, transparency and accountability deployed on the conduct of government businesses, exco approved the recommendations of the Fiscal responsibility commission with regards to Ministries of Agriculture and Natural Resources and that of Ministry of Human Capital Development, which commended the honesty, transparency and fairness exhibited in all activities of government as approved to Ministry of Human Capital Development and Ministries of Agriculture and Natural Resources, respectively.
Exco further approved the training of all stakeholders to ensure compliance with all applicable tax laws and regulations.
“After an exhaustive deliberation on the report on Model Secondary School projects as submitted by the Committee, Exco approved the immediate termination of the marked projects for poor performance by the handlers as recommended by the Committee”
